column4: wifi randomly disconnecting in 11.04 wth rt3090 card (blacklisted drivers) here is the sys log http://paste.ubuntu.com/675271/
open a terminal, type dmesg | pastebinit<enter>
what will that do?
what have you tried? you done any research? is this first time you're seeing this? did you change something?
can you connect without wicd?

I've tried blacklisting a couple more suggested drivers but it doesn't help, this is indeed the first time I'm seeing this and I haven't changed anything at all apart from adding dkms + a package for the card and blacklisting drivers
I've read about wicd but how will it help?
make you remember what you blacklisted. why were you blacklisting stuff?
I was blacklisting stuff because there are conflicting drivers for my wireless card under ubuntu
so it didn't work, then you blacklisted, now it works but intermittently
what's the signal strength list? what's the refresh period on your WLAN set to?
this is what I blacklisted and yes it wasn't working before blacklist and now it is but it conks out after a minute or so rt2800pci rt2800lib rt2x00usb rt2x00pci rt2x00lib rt2860sta
signal strength when connected is full and I've no idea what the refresh rate is
didn't happen after a kernel update perhaps? i wouldn't go wicd yet. its will help if there's a bug in network-manager (I think)
no I haven't changed a thing since my wubi install, it can't update the kernel because of the wireless conking out
when I say I haven't changed anything i mean nothing I haven't said
you'd probably be best off going somewhere with an ethernet connection and updating everything. then see if that doesn't solve your problem
hmm ok
might as well just try Oneiric when it comes out if I'm gonna do that
i'm still trying to get my wifi working even after updates, 11.04 and Oneric. Mine is AR9271
wifi is not linux's strength. But if all else fails you can try linuxwireless.org, the #linux-wireless channel, and really get into things with iw and wap-supplicant
